description.raw:
Gazebo supports light insertion since [this](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2200/process-insertions-on-world-setstate/diff) pull request, but the use case for that pull request only works because we're not using the SDF parser to extract the light insertions from SDF.

Without the change here, trying to use the parser on something like

~~~
<insertions>
  <light .../>
</insertions>
~~~

gives this warning:

~~~
Warning [parser.cc:778] XML Element[light], child of element[insertions] not defined in SDF. Ignoring[light]. You may have an incorrect SDF file, or an sdformat version that doesn't support this element.
~~~
description.html:
Gazebo supports light insertion since this pull request, but the use case for that pull request only works because we're not using the SDF parser to extract the light insertions from SDF.

Without the change here, trying to use the parser on something like

<insertions>
  <light .../>
</insertions>

gives this warning:

Warning [parser.cc:778] XML Element[light], child of element[insertions] not defined in SDF. Ignoring[light]. You may have an incorrect SDF file, or an sdformat version that doesn't support this element.

title: Support light insertion in state

summary.html:
Gazebo supports light insertion since this pull request, but the use case for that pull request only works because we're not using the SDF parser to extract the light insertions from SDF.

Without the change here, trying to use the parser on something like

<insertions>
  <light .../>
</insertions>

gives this warning:

Warning [parser.cc:778] XML Element[light], child of element[insertions] not defined in SDF. Ignoring[light]. You may have an incorrect SDF file, or an sdformat version that doesn't support this element.
